channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Stretch your summer at Florida’s best spas and wellness escapes
item.description: Labor Day may mark the unofficial end of summer, but in Florida, the heat and the chance for indulgence between hurricanes linger long after the last backyard barbecue. For those not ready to trade flip-flops for fall, the state’s top spas and wellness spaces offer one more excuse to savor summer.

item.title: Vote for the Herald-Tribune Girls Athlete of the Week for Sept. 22-27
item.description: Each week The Herald-Tribune staff will select nominees for the Herald-Tribune Girls Athlete of the Week poll sponsored by Central Florida Behavioral Network, Inc. Nominees are derived from scores and stats emailed in by Sarasota and Manatee county coaches during the week tohtincoming@gmail.com. Readers can then vote in the online poll to determine the Girls Athlete of the Week.

item.title: IMG remains No. 1 on USA Today Florida Football Super 25 in Week 7
item.description: IMG remains the clear-cut top team in the state of Florida.

item.title: Sarasota Yacht Club sailing director wins F18 North American title
item.description: Dalton Tebo and John Casey spent four days sailing an 18-foot catamaran named El Cucuy around Newport, Rhode Island, at the end of August.

item.title: Spirit Airlines furloughing 730 flight attendants at Florida airports
item.description: Spirit Airlines,struggling with its second bankruptcyin a year, filednoticeswith Florida officials on Sept. 25 that the airline will be furloughing 730 flight attendents at three airports in the state starting Dec. 1.

item.title: Bradenton Beach City Attorney retires amid corruption lawsuit
item.description: Bradenton Beach City Attorney Ricinda Perry retired on Sept. 18 after 21 years of service following involvement ina lawsuit alleging corruptionand other controversies during the 2024 hurricane season.

item.title: Hurricane Imelda now in Atlantic. How strong will it get?
item.description: In a hurry? Here's what you need to know aboutHurricane Imelda in less than a minute.

item.title: What happens to Social Security in Florida in a…
item.description: It's hours away. If President Donald Trump and congressional Democrats cannotcome to an agreementover government spending, apartial government shutdownwill begin on Wednesday, Oct. 1.

item.title: Attorney in Epic Universe ride death says 'warning…
item.description: The family of aman who died after riding a rollercoaster at Epic Universesaid they are now aware of multiple complaints and reports of injuries regarding the attraction since it opened.

item.title: Imelda now a hurricane. Will Florida, Sarasota-Manatee…
item.description: Hurricane Imeldaformed Tuesday morning, Sept. 30, and is beginning to take a slow turn away from Florida, according to the latest update from the National Hurricane Center.

item.title: 14 local restaurants get high-priority violations, 20 ace inspections
item.description: Ourdigital databaseof restaurant health inspections is updated regularly with the latest information on which Sarasota, Bradenton and Venice area restaurants passed or failed.

item.title: Sarasota County OKs $2.52B budget with stormwater, sheriff boosts
item.description: Sarasota County Commissioners have approved a $2.52 billion total budget, a 73% increase in spending from just three years ago, asproperty tax revenueshave soared.

item.title: Beach-themed adventure park opens in Sarasota County with giant slides
item.description: When Sarasota’s rainy season hits or a cold snap rolls through, families may be forced to cut back on theirbeach time. But a beachy new adventure park that just opened its doors in North Port is saving the day.

item.title: Did a 'world famous' Sarasota restaurant close? Here's what we know
item.description: A Sarasota restaurant and tiki bar billed as “world-famous” and known for its stoner-friendly vibe and menu — featuring items like the Dankalicious Nugz, Legal Greens, and the Wake & Bake brunch special — along with a memorable national television appearance, has apparentlyclosed.
